comments:
This is not reproducible but here is wat I did to trigger it the 1st time:

Opened the site explorer view with an FTP & a DAV site already configured.
Deleted them both then tried to create a new FTP site using the same server but
no username or pwd.
The dialog vanished then reappeared with the URL still filled in but did not
create a new site. Clicking on Finish did not make it go away.

I looked in the log file & found this stack trace for each time I had hit
Finish:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Jun 03, 2002 15:48:17.361
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Jun 03, 2002 15:48:17.363
!MESSAGE Assertion failed: ContentViewer must have a content provider when input
is set.
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert$AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed:
ContentViewer must have a content provider when input is set.

I've duplicated this problem but haven't been able to determine how the content
provider for the folderTree gets nulled. When the tree is created it is
initialized with a content provider, so it should exist is the siteAdded() method.

I've changed the site added method and have not been able to duplicated since. I
think that this was the problem. Closing.

traces.message: Assertion failed: ContentViewer must have a content provider when input is set.
